intro: Hutera hispida, commonly known as the rough hutera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Hutera hispida typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
